sentences: Stephanie Young Hwang (born August 1, 1989), known professionally as Tiffany or Tiffany Young, is an  American singer.
section: N/A

sentences: Born and raised in California, she was discovered by South Korean entertainment agency SM Entertainment at the age of fifteen and subsequently moved to South Korea.
section: N/A

sentences: After two years of training, Tiffany debuted as a member of girl group Girls' Generation (and later its subgroup Girls' Generation-TTS) in August 2007, which went on to become one of the best-selling artists in South Korea and one of South Korea's most popular girl groups worldwide.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2016, Tiffany became the second Girls' Generation member to debut as a soloist with the release of her first extended play I Just Wanna Dance.
section: N/A

sentences: Although Tiffany remains a member of Girls' Generation, she left SM Entertainment in October 2017.
section: N/A

sentences: She is currently based in Los Angeles for her solo career.
section: N/A

sentences: She joined Paradigm Talent Agency and signed with record label Transparent Arts prior to the release of her 2019 extended play Lips on Lips.

sentences: Her family consists of her father, an older sister, and an older brother.

sentences: Her mother died when she was 12 years old, and she is estranged from her father.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2012: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She grew up in Diamond Bar, California, and was inspired by K-pop artist BoA. Encouraged by her brother, at the age of 15, Tiffany participated in a singing contest.

sentences: She was spotted by a local SM Entertainment representative, auditioned, and was accepted as a trainee.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2012: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: She moved to South Korea three weeks later.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2012: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Tiffany attended Korea Kent Foreign School and was trained at SM Entertainment for almost four years.

sentences: She officially debuted as a member of South Korean girl group Girls' Generation in August 2007.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2012: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: The singer adopted the stage name Tiffany, the name her mother initially wanted to name her at birth.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2012: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: Besides Girls' Generation, Tiffany's early solo work mostly involved songs recorded for side projects and original soundtracks.

sentences: Throughout her career, she also participated as the host for several television programs.
section: == Life and career == | === 1989–2012: Early life and career beginnings ===

sentences: In early 2008, Tiffany was diagnosed with vocal nodules and had to receive medical treatment.

sentences: In December 2011–January 2012, Tiffany debuted as a musical actress through a lead role in the Korean adaptation of musical Fame.

sentences: She played the character Carmen Diaz, a performing arts student who "hopes to rise to stardom by working tirelessly on her craft".

sentences: In April 2012, a Girls' Generation subgroup named TTS was formed with Tiffany and fellow members Taeyeon and Seohyun.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2017: Girls’ Generation TTS, solo debut and controversy ===

sentences: Their debut EP, Twinkle, debuted at number one on the Gaon Album Chart and went on to become the eighth highest selling album of the year in South Korea with over 140,000 copies sold.

sentences: The subgroup went on to release two more EPs: Holler (2014) and Dear Santa (2015).
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2017: Girls’ Generation TTS, solo debut and controversy ===

sentences: The singer was paired with designer Ji Il-geun and finished the program in third place.

sentences: Her album met with mixed but generally favorable reviews.

sentences: It sold 61,409 physical copies and was chosen by Billboard as the seventh best K-pop album of 2016.

sentences: The lead single, and title track, "I Just Wanna Dance" debuted at number 10 on both the Billboard World Digital Songs Chart and the Gaon Digital Chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2012–2017: Girls’ Generation TTS, solo debut and controversy ===

sentences: In June 2016, the follow-up single "Heartbreak Hotel", featuring Simon Dominic, was released through SM Station digital music platform.

sentences: To accompany her solo releases, Tiffany held a series of small concerts titled Weekend during the same month.

section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Departure from SM Entertainment and solo career ===

sentences: On March 14, 2018, Tiffany released a cover of "Remember Me," the theme song of the Pixar film Coco, as a single under the stage name Tiffany Young.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Departure from SM Entertainment and solo career ===

sentences: In June 2018, it was announced that she would be debuting in the United States under Paradigm Talent Agency.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Departure from SM Entertainment and solo career ===

sentences: She signed with Transparent Arts as her new record label, with "Over My Skin" as her first U.S. solo single.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Departure from SM Entertainment and solo career ===

sentences: Tiffany collaborated with and was made the face for H&M's Autumn 2018 campaign.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Departure from SM Entertainment and solo career ===

sentences: To coincide with their Divided Music fall campaign, Tiffany released her second U.S. single, "Teach You", which was released on September 28, 2018.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Departure from SM Entertainment and solo career ===

sentences: In October 2018, Tiffany was the first female K-pop artist to walk the red carpet of the American Music Awards.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Departure from SM Entertainment and solo career ===

sentences: She released a holiday single, "Peppermint", on November 30, 2018.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Departure from SM Entertainment and solo career ===

sentences: On January 9, 2019, Tiffany announced her next single, "Born Again," which would be released on January 24 as the lead single of her next EP, entitled Lips on Lips; the single was moved one day later, on January 25, with Fernando Garibay confirmed as the song's producer.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Departure from SM Entertainment and solo career ===

sentences: The music video of "Born Again" was released alongside the single on January 25.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Departure from SM Entertainment and solo career ===

sentences: The EP's title track was released as the second single on February 14.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Departure from SM Entertainment and solo career ===

sentences: Lips on Lips was released on February 22.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Departure from SM Entertainment and solo career ===

sentences: Lips on Lips debuted at number nine on Billboard's Heatseekers Albums chart and number thirty on the Independent Albums chart, with 1,000 copies downloaded and 380,000 on-demand audio streams.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Departure from SM Entertainment and solo career ===

sentences: The EP also peaked at number eight at the Gaon Album Chart, and was certified Platinum in South Korea a week after its release.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Departure from SM Entertainment and solo career ===

sentences: She promoted the EP through her Lips on Lips Mini Showcase Tour, which spanned eight dates around North America in March 2019.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–present: Departure from SM Entertainment and solo career ===

sentences: She won Best Solo Breakout at the 2019 iHeartRadio Music Awards, which aired on March 14, 2019.

sentences: Subsequently, she embarked on the Magnetic Moon Tour from October to November 2019, which covered eighteen tour stops in North America.

sentences: To win the role, Tiffany participated in an open audition from which only 22 actors were selected from over a thousand applicants.

sentences: Tiffany stated that she dreamed of being a musical actress and that Roxie is one of the top three roles she wanted to play.
